Find out more about this API

put.summary: Creates a dataset in the catalogue.
put.description:
Add a new dataset in the data catalogue.

A dataset may have one of two type of sources (the _source_ field): feed and file.

A dataset with a feed data source is populated pushing data streams to a feed API using the EEML format. Once created, a new feed API exposed to allow you to push the data.

A dataset with a file data source is populated uploading files or pointing to open web resources providing an HTTP urls. Multiples files and URLs are allowed for this type of source.

A dataset supports of one of these two type of sources: feed or file, but not both of them.

You need to provide an api key. If you haven't done already, you can activate a key to the Data Catalogue dataset through the MK Data Hub Portal. Go to Find Data and look for the Data Catalogue dataset. Then, use the activate button to register a key. This key can be used to read and write to the Data Catalogue dataset through this API.

Location.description: API location of the dataset metadata

403.description: Forbidden. Api key cannot create Datasets

406.description: The dataset already exists, to modify the data use the sections endpoints: /info, /access and /stream /

patch.description: With this method, only the provided fields are updated. The remaining fields are not modified.

200.description: The file metadata has been updated
